fields.description:
When using the Documentation Theme, it's possible to change its colors by Space Admin > Colour Scheme > Custom Colour Scheme > edit.

If you change the Heading Text color, it doesn't work. It works for Default Theme.

The same happens when changing this color on a Global configuration.
fields.summary: can't change heading text color for documentation theme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-20129].
  {panel}

h4.Problem:

User token cannot be searched, thus impossibility the user from searching inside a Profile. 

h4.Improvement:

User Tokens and Fields to be part of Search and Index.
Anything inside the Profile would be part of Index and would be possible to be searched.

h4.Workaround:

Unfortunately there is no known workaround.
fields.summary: Confluence Search Fields - Personal Information so that it includes things like Position, Department, Location etc

fields.description:
When there are at least two links located at newline each, like the pattern below:
{noformat}
[Link 1]
<new line>
[Link 2]
<new line>
Any text here
{noformat}

Switching between Editor and Wiki Markup, a new line space will be added. This scenario will only happens, when there is a line space in between the links.


*Step to reproduce the bug:*
# Use Firefox (I'm using version 3.6.3) and create a page, then paste the following into the editor:
{noformat}
[link 1]

[link 2]

[link 3]

Any text
{noformat}
# Switching between Editor and Wiki Markup to reproduce the bug.

\\
*NOTE:* This bug does not happen in IE8 and Chrome internet browser.
fields.summary: Switching between Editor and Wiki Markup containing at least two links will cause second link to add new line space

fields.description: Since the upgrade to 3.3-beta3, CPU utilisation has increased noticeably and we've been encountering 502 exceptions at an increasing rate.
fields.summary: Increasing 502 exceptions on EAC

fields.description:
We have identified and fixed a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the Confluence Clickr theme.
* An attacker might take advantage of the vulnerability to steal other users' session cookies or other credentials, by sending the credentials back to such an attacker's own web server.
* An attacker's text and script might be displayed to other people viewing the Confluence page. This is potentially damaging to your company's reputation.

This issue is reported in our security advisory on this page:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/_ggODQ

You can read more about XSS attacks at cgisecurity, CERT and other places on the web:
* http://www.cgisecurity.com/xss-faq.html
* http://www.cert.org/advisories/CA-2000-02.html
fields.summary: XSS vulnerability in Clickr theme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-20118].
{panel}
It would be good if you could assign a group to be notified when a page or space is changed.

This was original wrapped up as part of --CONF-3703--, but split out because we implemented the more "assign page watches" part of that issue first.
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of December 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi all,

Thank you for providing your feedback on this suggestion.

Unfortunately, we have no plans to implement this suggestion for pages or spaces (see my final paragraph for blogs). As a result, we're closing this request.

Based on customer feedback, we’ve worked hard to reduce the amount of email notifications end-users receive. We’re concerned that implementing a group watchers feature has the potential to undo these past improvements.

In enabling group watchers, users added as watchers of a page or space via this functionality would be unable to remove themselves. This has the potential to create a greater level of frustration for some users compared to the benefits this feature might bring.

As I’m sure many of you are aware, there are multiple workarounds available to address this issue:
 - Admins are currently able to add/remove watchers of pages on an individual basis
 - The functionality exists to share a page with a group (useful when significant changes have been made to that page)
 - Multiple add-ons are available to enable group watching of blogs:
 - [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.adaptavist.confluence.enterpriseNotifications/server/overview]
 - [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.arijea.plugins.betterblogs/server/overview]

We do however see potential future value in allowing group watchers for blogs. Unless a specific blog post is being watched, blog notifications will only trigger when a blog is created, so can be invaluable for sharing information with a large audience. If you're interested in managing group and individual watchers for blogs, please vote on CONFSERVER-24353, or the related CONFSERVER-30644.

Best
 Jenny Millman | Product Manager - Confluence Server
{panel}
fields.summary: Ability to notify a group when a page blog or space is changed (group watches)
BandanaEditor / SAL API setValue() problems?

fields.description:
Since the fix for CONF-13846 Confluence is case sensitive for wildcard searches.

One can easily fix that using the patch [^diff-tng-confluence-3.1-source-wildcard-case]. This patch works also for Confluence 3.2, just the lines of the universal diff does not match any more. IMHO for 3.0 the patch can be applied as it is.
fields.summary: Fix case sensitivity in wildcard searches
Expand current node

fields.description:
While we don't have a server-side spell checker as requested in [CONF-1212] the browser spell checker in Firefox and Safari and Chrome are pretty good. However, the RTE context menu interferes with browser spell checker suggestions. Perhaps there's a way to combine the best of both worlds so that right clicking gives spell check options when a word is misspelled and context menus when it's properly spelled? Maybe there's another way?

!http://img.skitch.com/20100618-pwewmt75j9ecdwgdhysr9tya2e.jpg!

!http://img.skitch.com/20100618-g6uc64wrarai819m2m4s2jcgs6.jpg!
fields.summary: Make context menus not interfere with browser spell checker

fields.description:
As far as I know, all spaces on a confluence installation are accessible to Confluence Admins no matter the security applied by the owners of the space. Is there a plugin to apply such that the admins can not view the contents of a space if the space owners restrict those spaces as such?

I am using a .war   deployed on JBoss.

Thanks.
John.
fields.summary: Privacy of documents

fields.description:
In confluence 3.0.1 when the {gallery} macro is used on a page, the +Add,+Tools and user and general browser pulldown menus are broken. The Edit button on the page remains functional, but in order to reactivate any of the other menus on the page, it must be edited to comment out the {gallery} macro, make changes, then reactivate the {gallery} macro.

(yes, I acknowledge that I did not do an exhaustive search of the support forums or this Jira etc. to see if this issue has already been reported.)
fields.summary: Gallery macro in Confluence 3.0.1 breaks +Add and +Tools page menus, browse and user pulldown menus

fields.description:
After applying the patches from [2010-05-04 security advisory|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Security+Advisory+2010-05-04#ConfluenceSecurityAdvisory2010-05-04-Step1ofthePatchProcedure%3AInstallthePatches], the search box in link editor spits code:

{code:none}
$generalUtil.escapeXml($!searchQuery.queryString)
{code}

To reproduce, just open the link editor while editing a page.

This is due to the included patch _WEB-INF\classes\com\atlassian\confluence\util\GeneralUtil.class_

Problem does not exist in patch for 3.x.
fields.summary: Link editor displays raw Velocity code after applying security patch

fields.description:
The latest version of JIRA has changed the response codes used for REST resources used by the pie chart and this exposes a bug in atlassian-gadgets in handling responses without a body:

https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AG-1273

This will break use of these gadgets in Confluence 3.1 and 3.2 as well as on trunk.

JIRA development issue:

http://jdog.atlassian.com/browse/JRADEV-1903
fields.summary: Pie chart JIRA gadget won't load with JIRA 4.2

fields.description:
The new {{help-paths.properties}} file is currently in the {{confluence.jar}} in the *WEB-INF/lib* directory.

Instead, it should be a standalone config file in the *WEB-INF/classes* directory. This will make it easy for customers to change the values in the file and repoint their help links. It will also standardise the help design with that of JIRA.

(i) This affects our documentation:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF54/Local+Confluence+Documentation
fields.summary: The help-paths.properties file should be a standalone config file in WEB-INF/lib
Gallery Macro - ability to set max number of images to get
Gallery Macro - ability to get images from a page and its children, rather than just a page

fields.description: Tests that consistently pass in com.atlassian.confluence.selenium.qa can be moved to com.atlassian.confluence.selenium
fields.summary: Move QA Selenium tests into the Selenium suite

fields.description:
When uploading a plugin, it would be nice to see some feedback on the upload status. Some plugins can be quite large and slow to upload, and since browsers still don't display any upload progress themselves, we should. As a strawman design, the progress could be shown in an overlay showing a standard progress bar plus some status text saying something like "Uploading file: [name] [m]/[n]KB completed". 

If the validation and installation steps take a noticable amount of time, then we should also think about showing validation progress as part of the same progress widget.
fields.summary: Show progress during plugin upload

fields.description: I was viewing http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Example+SQL+queries+for+JIRA and I noticed that whenever I scrolled up, the screen was overtaken by the horizontal bars.  It was really annoying and I had to refresh the page every time I scrolled up.  This occured using Mozilla Fire Fox 3.5.9.
fields.summary: Horizontal bars overtake wiki pages when I scroll up.

fields.description:
Hello,

We would like an improvement done to the table or table-plus macro(s) to have the ability to collapse/expand a row in a table.
fields.summary: Ability to collapse/expand a row in a table

fields.description:
h5. Bug Background

# This issue is caused by [CONF-17414], where empty title can exists within Confluence pages due to Doc Import feature
# Once the Confluence instance has this untitled page, there could be a situation where users want to fix the bug by finding the untitled page and rename it.
# Although this can be done, it will break some other pages with attachment links in it within the same space. 

h5. Steps to reproduce
# Reproduce [CONF-17414] bug
# Create a page with the following Wiki Markup:
{code}
[^AnyAttachment.png]
{code}
# Attach the AnyAttachment.png file to the page
# Rename the untitled page (can access the page through direct link)
# The page with the attachment will break with the link looking like the following:
{code}
[NewTitleOfTheUntitledPage^AnyAttachment.png]
{code}

h5. Findings
This happens to all pages in the space where the Untitled page resides

h5. Workaround
As a workaround, you might want to use the [Global Search and Replace Plugin|https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/162] to search and replace the links.
fields.summary: Empty page title causes broken attachment links when the page title is changed

fields.description: See https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/EMLPAGE-31

fields.description:
The help links on various Confluence screens are hard-coded to specific URLs on CAC. Instead, they should use the new configurable and release-dependent design for help links, as described in CONF-11416.

*1) Dropdown when adding a page*
See attached screenshot "*HelpLinkAddPage.png*".
The hard-coded link is on the word "*tempates*".


*2) Confluence Gadgets lightbox*
See attached screenshot "*HelpLinkConfluenceGadgets.png*".
The hard-coded link is on the word "*documentation*".
fields.summary: Hard-coded help links in various user actions should use the new configurable linking design

fields.description:
At the top left of the Confluence dashboard is a welcome message. It contains the following text:
{quote}
Confluence combines powerful online authoring capabilities, deep Office integration and an extensive plugin catalog to help people work better together and share information effortlessly.

Get started by creating a new space and adding users to join you.

You can change this message to whatever you like.
{quote}

The above message contains 3 hyperlinks, on the following words:
* creating a new space
* adding users
* change this message

Currently the help links are all hard-coded to the full URL on CAC.

Instead, they should use the new configurable and release-dependent design for help links, as described in CONF-11416.
fields.summary: Hard-coded help links in Dashboard welcome message should use the new configurable linking design

fields.description: Safari 5 came out June 7, 2010. Should look at supporting this for Confluence.
fields.summary: Confluence Support for Safari 5

fields.description:
*1) Administration Console front screen - daily backups*
In the Confluence Administration Console is a screen called "Administration Console". This is the first screen you see when you select "Browse" -> "Confluence Admin".
(Local URL is http://localhost:8080/admin/console.action.)

On that screen is a section warning people about daily backups. In that section is some hyperlinked text:

{quote}Instead, we recommend that you perform a manual backup of your Confluence database, home directory and attachments. For more information, please refer to our online documentation.{quote}

Currently, the help link on the words "our online documentation" is hard-coded to the following URL:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/_n4C

Instead, it should use the new configurable and release-dependent design for help links, as described in CONF-11416. The page name to link to is: "Site+Backup+and+Restore".

*2) Administration Console front screen - evaluation database (HSQL)*
In the Confluence Administration Console is a screen called "Administration Console". This is the first screen you see when you select "Browse" -> "Confluence Admin".
(Local URL is http://localhost:8080/admin/console.action.)

There is a section at the bottom warning people about the evaluation database (HSQL).

In that section is some hyperlinked text:

{quote}Please refer to our online documentation for supported database configurations.{quote}

Currently, the help link on the words "our online documentation" is broken. 

It should use the new configurable and release-dependent design for help links, as described in CONF-11416. The page name to link to is: "Supported+Platforms".

*3) Daily Backup Administration  - evaluation database (HSQL)*
The same problem mentioned in point 2 above also occurs on the screen called "Daily Backup Administration".
(Local URL is http://localhost:8080/admin/dailybackupadmin.action.)

Note: The section in the "Help Tips" is OK but the yellow warning box is not.

*4) General configuration screen - remote API*
In the Confluence Administration Console is a screen called "General Configuration ". 
(Local URL is http://localhost:8080/admin/viewgeneralconfig.action.)

On the right of that screen is a section called "Help Tips". In that section is some hyperlinked text:
{quote}More about Remote APIs{quote}

Currently, the help link on the above words is broken. It cannot use the standard new linking design, because it has to link to the CONFDEV space rather than the DOC space. So we will need to use a permlink.

The page to link to is:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/3QI

*5) Plugin Manager*
In the Confluence Administration Console is a screen called "Plugin Manager". 
(Local URL is http://localhost:8080/admin/viewplugins.action.)

On the right of that screen is a section called "Help Tips". In that section is some hyperlinked text:
{quote}More about plugins{quote}

Currently, the help link on the above words is broken. It is using the new help link design, which is good. But it is pointing to the wrong page. The page name to link to is: "Installing+Plugins+and+Macros".

*6) User Macros*
In the Confluence Administration Console is a screen called "User Macros". 
(Local URL is http://localhost:8080/admin/usermacros.action.)

On the right of that screen is a section called "Help Tips". In that section is some hyperlinked text:
{quote}More about user macros{quote}

Currently, the help link on the above words is broken. It is using the new help link design, which is good. But it is pointing to the wrong page. The page name to link to is:
"Adding%2C+Editing+and+Removing+User+Macros"

*7) WebDAV Configuration*
In the Confluence Administration Console is a screen called "WebDAV Configuration". 
(Local URL is http://localhost:8080/admin/plugins/webdav/config.action.)

On that screen is a section called "Disable Strict Path Checking". In that section is some hyperlinked text:

{quote}...fix it by rebuilding the ancestor table.{quote}

Currently, the help link on the words "rebuilding the ancestor table" is hard-coded to the following URL:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Rebuilding+the+Ancestor+Table

Instead, it should use the new configurable and release-dependent design for help links, as described in CONF-11416. The page name to link to is: "Rebuilding+the+Ancestor+Table".

*8) Generate Thread Dumps*
In the Confluence Administration Console is a screen called "Generate Thread Dumps". 
(Local URL is http://localhost:8080/admin/threaddump.action.)

Near the top of the screen is some hyperlinked text:

{quote}Please refer to the documentation for...{quote}

Currently, the help link on the word "documentation" is hard-coded to the following URL:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Generating+a+Thread+Dump

Instead, it should use the new configurable and release-dependent design for help links, as described in CONF-11416. The page name to link to is: "Generating+a+Thread+Dump".
fields.summary: Hard-coded help links in Admin Console screens should use the new configurable linking design
Improve the intuitiveness of editing Gadgets in Confluence once they've been added to a page

fields.description:
I configured the Page Gadget on a dashboard in JDog. 
I authorised it as part of the configuration process.
I then shared that dashboard with other people.

All they see is an error with no way to authenticate:

!JDogError.jpg!

If I revoke my OAuth access token I see the same error. This makes the gadget useless for sharing.
fields.summary: Page Gadget cannot be authenticated after configuration

fields.description:
Listing undefined or orphaned pages doesn't scale at all because it is being recomputed on every request with minimal caching. This results in bad user experience or inability to retrieve the information at all (due to network timeouts). We are currently experiencing major problems with spaces that contain only a few hundred pages.

I see in the source code that mysql is being treated differently than other databases, and that implementation of this special case is the source of the inefficiency.
fields.summary: Listing undefined or orphaned pages doesn't scale

fields.description:
Write some text into the Rich Text editor and then select a space between two words. Choose Insert -> Symbol and then use mdash. It renders correctly. Save the page and look at what you get and it changes to a series of hyphens. Edit again and look at Wiki Code. Same thing happens with a space between the words and the mdash but it changes to three hyphens. The correct use of the mdash is to use it without spaces.

I looked in the database and there is an issue already reported for this and labeled fixed. It's CONF-501 and it's 6 years old. Perhaps this is a regressed bug?
fields.summary: mdash from Insert Symbol incorrectly rendered
Update documentation

fields.description:
Here are the steps on how to reproduce this bug:
# Create a new Excel workbook
# Create a hyperlink in cell B22
# Add text to cell L3 (without hyperlinks)
# Save file
# Upload file attachment to Confluence and use the viewxls macro to display the file
# You will be able to see a rendered version of the table makes L3 a hyperlink to the destination specified in cell B22

Not only that, there is also a strange pattern/behavior where you can see:
A12 --> link applied to K2
B12 --> link applied to L2
B32 --> link applied to L4
B42 --> link applied to L5
B52 --> link applied to L6
C22 --> link applied to M3
C32 --> link applied to M4
D22 --> link applied to N3
E22 --> link applied to 03
F22 --> link applied to P3
G22 --> link applied to Q3

Please refer to my Excel attachment in this ticket (Book1.xls) to understand the scenario better.
fields.summary: Strange behavior in Viewfile macro if cell contains hyperlinks

fields.description:
In the macro browser dialog for page gadget. 
When the user focuses on the text box for a space, the text "All Spaces" should disappear, but is, instead, writeable.
Instead of disappearing, when the user clicks in this text field, the cursor is placed at the end of the text and the user must backspace over it.
fields.summary: Text "All Spaces" should disappear when user focuses on the text box to type in a space name in Page Gadget
Enable caching on label queries

fields.description:
*1) First screen*
In the space administration section is a screen called "PDF Layout". 
(EAC URL is {{https://extranet.atlassian.com/spaces/flyingpdf/viewpdflayoutconfig.action?key=DOCTST}}, where the space is DOCTST.)

On the right of that screen is a section called "Help Tips". In that section is some hyperlinked text:
{quote}Refer to Editing the PDF Stylesheet for more information about using this page.{quote}

Currently, the help link on the words "Editing the PDF Stylesheet" is hard-coded to the following URL:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Editing+the+PDF+Stylesheet

Instead, it should use the new configurable and release-dependent design for help links, as described in CONF-11416.

*2) Second screen*
The same problem occurs on the "PDF Stylesheet" space admin screen.
({{https://extranet.atlassian.com/spaces/flyingpdf/viewpdfstyleconfig.action?key=DOCTST}}).
fields.summary: Hard-coded help link on PDF Layout screen should use the new configurable linking design

fields.description:
The same markup is produced by the blog post macro and the browse space blogs pages. However there are two separate templates for them, one in Confluence and one in the plugin. We really should have one template in Confluence that produces the markup so we don't have to update 2 different places each time. We should also extract it out of space.vmd as it is hard to read.

I have also noticed that there text not i18n. e.g. Labels, Read more
fields.summary: Blog post macro and the browse space blogs should use the same template

fields.description: Something has happened to the dialog for Page gadget in Firefox.  The page gadget dialog no longer has a "save" button so there is no way to add a page gadget from Firefox.  The dialog is in tact for IE and Safari 4.
fields.summary: "Save" button does not appear Gadget preferences in macro browser for Firefox

fields.description:
I am the Confluence Admin for our site, and there are often occasions that come up where I wish to masquerade as an ordinary user, to perform actions which will appear as though they originated by that user.

An example might be to change a profile picture (tracked separately in CONF-6112), or to correct spelling errors or formatting issues on a page that another user has authored. Many of our users lack proficiency in web authoring skills, and sometimes discrete "touch ups" or corrections would be highly valuable. In these cases, I do not want the changes to be attributed to an admin user who has performed these changes. It would be best if the changes appear to have been made by the original user.

Many web apps allow an admin to temporarily "become" or otherwise assume the identify of a regular user in order to perform actions that need to be executed as that user. Common examples are content authoring/editing, but this feature is also useful for checking user permissions and application functionality as though one were logged in as that user.
fields.summary: Allow admins to masquerade as ordinary users

fields.description:
In IE8
Create page 1 inside of space 1 which will be displayed in a page gadget
Create page 2 with a page gadget containing page 1 from space 1
Move page 1 from space 1 to space 2
The page 2 which has the page gadget containing page 1 looks fine in IE

In FF3.6, Page 2 will not render the page gadget and does not display an error.  

Screenshot is attached.
fields.summary: Page gadget will not display a page that has been moved from one space to a different space

fields.description:
From https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/SUPPORT/Workflow+Documentation, click the image or the "Full Size" link, and the resulting page will display the string
  $globalHelper.renderConfluenceMacro($macro) 
instead of the image.
fields.summary: View Gliffy Diagram returns $globalHelper string

fields.description: Confluence 3.3 introduced Autocomplete for Macros. This works with Macros that are part of the Confluence plugin system. We should look at extending this to incorporate user macros as well.
fields.summary: Embed User Macros in Macro Autocomplete

fields.description:
Here are the following steps to reproduce the bug:
# Open IE 6 browser.
# In the Confluence instance, make sure that there are a couple of pages whereby it has quite a long content or summary.
# Using the Confluence Quick Search and search for any word that exists in the content of the page.
# The search results will appear to *overlap* with the space name when the summary is too long (please see attached screenshot). 

This does not happen in IE 7, 8, and Firefox. 

Though I understand that IE 6 will be very soon no longer be supported when Confluence 3.3 is released, I still think is worth raise it up.
fields.summary: Search results appears to overlap with the space name in IE6 when the summary is too long

fields.description:
The database queries to retrieve orphaned pages require the use of nested queries. As this is not supported in older versions of MySQL, an alternative was implemented that does not use the database that is very inefficient - it loads up all pages of the required space into memory and then checks each one to determine if it's an orphaned page - this is both memory and processor inefficient. It is particularly noticeable on larger spaces. 

Given that the minimum supported version of MySQL is now 5.0, this special handling for MySQL is unnecessary and detrimental to the performance of our MySQL customers. 

Action: Remove this handling.
fields.summary: Remove special pre-mysql 4.1 handling in query to fetch orphaned pages (which is really slow for large spaces)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-20056].
  {panel}

A number of changes in the SearchUsersAction between 2.9 and 2.10 breaks the ability of an administrator to do full name searching to reduce the number of hits that Manage users returns on full name search.

Steps to reproduce:
Create two users, test1(Joe Smith) and test2(Joe Rogers).  
Do a search for Joe Smith

2.9 returns 1 result. 
2.10+ returns both results.

This is because every search term is OR'ed.  There doesn't seem to be a way to force it to AND the search terms.

In extremely large environments, this leads to an inability to effectively manage users.
fields.summary: Changes to manage users between Confluence 2.9 to 2.10 forces ORs between search terms

Allow nested {toc-zone} macros

fields.description:
Macro browser displays default output type for macro {toc-zone} is list, but in reality it is 'flat'.

1) open macro browser and lookup toc-zone macro
2) macro browser shows output type = 'list'
3) change nothing and click 'Save'
4) macro generated is {toc-zone} without any parameters
5) save page
6) what you will get will be toc formatted as 'flat'

Solution for this issue is trivial: change default output type displayed in Macro browser to 'flat' or change default output type generated by macro without specifying it to 'list'...
fields.summary: Macro browser {toc-zone} shows output type=list, but saves it as flat

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce
# Using image macro *with* align parameter:
#* Write the following wiki-markup:
{code}
h3. This is Atlassian logo
!atl.png|align=right!

h3. This is Confluence Logo
!conf.png|align=left!

h3. This is JIRA Logo
!jira.png|align=center!
{code}
#* [^incorrect_w_align.png] - The images display in *incorrect* order/position
# Using image macro *without* align parameter:
#* Write the following wiki-markup:
{code}
h3. This is Atlassian logo
!atl.png!

h3. This is Confluence Logo
!conf.png!

h3. This is JIRA Logo
!jira.png!
{code}
#* [^correct_wo_align.png] - The images display in *correct* order/position

h5. Findings
* If all images are using *center* align, it will display correctly
* If all images are using *left* or *right* align, it will display indented as if they were bulleted lists ([CONF-18762])
fields.summary: Images with different align parameters display in incorrect order/position

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce
# Using image macro *with* align parameter:
#* Write the following wiki-markup:
{code}
h5. This is Atlassian Logo
!atl.png!

h5. This is Confluence Logo
!conf.png|align=center!

h5. This is JIRA Logo
!jira.png|align=right!
{code}
#* [^preview_mode.png] - The third image is completely not showing in Preview mode
# Using image macro *without* align parameter:
#* [^preview_mode_wo_align.png] - All images are displayed completely in Preview mode
# Using image macro *with* align parameter (with some text):
#* Write the following wiki-markup:
{code}
h5. This is Atlassian Logo
!atl.png|thumbnail,align=left!
{loremipsum}

h5. This is Confluence Logo
!conf.png|align=center!
{loremipsum}

h5. This is JIRA Logo
!jira.png|align=right!
{loremipsum}
{code}
#* [^preview_mode2.png] - The third image gets truncated in Preview mode
# Using image macro *without* align parameter (with some text):
#* [^preview_mode2_wo_align.png] - All images are displayed completely in Preview mode
fields.summary: Some images with align parameter get truncated or not displayed completely in Preview mode

fields.description:
I am not too sure if this is a bug, however, the evaluation.properties (inside work dir) is there for this configuration (and I was told that this is supposed to work).

The content of the file:

{code:none}
#
#Fri Jun 11 14:59:27 SGT 2010
container.port.low=8080
container.port.high=9090
{code}

Confluence will keep start scanning at port 8080, even though {{container.port.low}} is set to other numbers e.g. 8085
fields.summary: Installer does not pickup port number specifications in evaluation.properties

fields.description:
Adding the following page to a gadget: https://qa-eac.atlassian.com/display/GREENZONE/Product+Spotlight+Report+%28Greenzone%29

Produces a gadget with a stack trace: https://qa-eac.atlassian.com/display/~mcompton/Page+gadget+sql+test

The page uses a combination of chart and sql macros to show reports.

Stack trace:
run: Unexpected program error: java.lang.NullPointerException
chart: com.atlassian.renderer.v2.macro.MacroException: Invalid width parameter. It must be an integer.

sql: dataSource: greenzoneDS not found.

select
$period_value,
sum(case when sale_type = 'New to New' then amount else 0 end) as "New to New",
sum(case when sale_type = 'New to Existing' then amount else 0 end) as "New to Existing",
sum(case when sale_type = 'Renewal' then amount else 0 end) as "Renewal",
sum(case when sale_type = 'Upgrade' then amount else 0 end) as "Upgrade",
sum(case when sale_type not in ('New to New', 'New to Existing', 'Renewal', 'Upgrade') then amount else 0 end) as "Other"
from sale
where
date > date_trunc('$period_value', current_date - interval '$months_value months')
and date < date_trunc('$period_value', current_date)
and product = '$product_value'
and edition != 'Starter'
group by $period_value
order by $period_value
	
chart: com.atlassian.renderer.v2.macro.MacroException: Invalid width parameter. It must be an integer.

$period_value,
sum(case when sale_type = 'New to New' then 1 else 0 end) as "New to New",
sum(case when sale_type = 'New to Existing' then 1 else 0 end) as "New to Existing",
sum(case when sale_type = 'Renewal' then 1 else 0 end) as "Renewal",

fields.description:
When the page gadget encounters a widget on a page that it can't deal with, it creates a blank gadget page.  

Widgets that cause this to happen:
Twitter
Friendfeed
iGoogle

examples of this can be found on this widget connector docs page:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF31/Widget+Connector+Examples#WidgetConnectorExamples-GoogleDocs
fields.summary: Page gadget does not quit gracefully when it encounters a widget url that does not work.

fields.description:
We currently don't know exactly what [widget macro|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Widget+Macro] content works in the page gadget and what does. Please investigate.

* gets: Google Gadgets (x), Widgetbox (?).
* Videos: YouTube (/), MySpace Video (/), Google Video (/), Yahoo Video (?), Dailymotion (?), Episodic (/), Vimeo (/), Metacafe (?), blip.tv (/), Viddler (/).
* Photos and images: Flickr (/), Skitch.com (/).
* Micro-blogging: Twitter (x), FriendFeed (x), BackType (?).
* Documents and presentations: SlideShare (/), SlideRocket (/), Scribd (/), presentations on Google Docs (/).
* Calendars: Google Calendar (/).
* Forms and online databases: Wufoo HTML Form Builder (x), Dabble DB (?).
fields.summary: Determine which widget content works in the page gadget

The content for inclusion in the build is here: https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/DRAFTDEMO

I believe that the content needs exported and anonymised, as per [this guideline|https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/TECHWRITING/How+to+update+the+Confluence+Demo+space#HowtoupdatetheConfluenceDemospace-5.NotifyDevsthatDemospaceisreadyforbuild].

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce
1) On a default install go to Administration > Global Permissions
2) See that the confluence-administrators by default has "Use Update Status" as disabled. 
3) Try to add a status update as a member of the confluence-administrators group and you will be able to it. 

I believe this is a correct, because super users (confluence-administrators) do have a permission to do anything... in which case, is there a point in showing that the update status is not enabled and is there a point for editing the permissions for super users at all?
fields.summary: By Default "Update User Status" is disabled for confluence-administrators group, but users in this group can use the update status feature
Disentangle social bookmarks from space permissions

fields.description:
h4.Problem:
As stated in Google Gears, Safari 4 is {color:red}NO longer Supported{color}

This is been reported by a customer,
And reproduced by [Jeremy Largman|http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=jlargman].

It doesn't let you install on Safari.

h4.Resolution:

Let's wait until HTML5 is implemented, and can be tracked at [CONF-19508|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-19508].

h4.Workaround:

For now you can use [Firefox|http://www.getfirefox.com], and wait until this is fixed.
fields.summary: Google Gears is not working with Safari 4
